contribution.name: 0 Model (Akita)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Built in 1993, this three-door 'long seat' model operating only on alternating current, was introduced to replace the remaning passanger cars in the Tohoku region and to improve the effectivity of conductorless services. Used on the Uetsu line north of Sakata, as well as on the Ou line in the Aomori area and on the Tsugaru line.

contribution.name: 100 Model / 3 Car Formation (Akita)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Built in 1993, this three-door 'long seat' model operating only on alternating current, was introduced to replace the remaning passanger cars in the Tohoku region and to improve the effectivity of conductorless services. The auxiliary power supply appeared after 94, converted from the MG model and are modified in SIV. Once the Yamagata Shinkansen Shinjo extension was built, this model was transferred to the Sendai Train Ward.

contribution.name: 1000 Model (Sendai / 2 Car formation)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: In the Sendai area, 701 Series trains were introduced to replace the 715 Series and 455 Series. 2 car (KUHA 700 + KUMOHA 701) and 4 car (KUHA 700 + MOHA 701 + SAHA 700 + KUMOHA 701) formations exist. While the 2-Car formation is a one-man driving setup, the 4-Car has no door chime.

contribution.name: 1000 Model(Sendai / 4-Car formation)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: In the Sendai area, 701 Series trains were introduced to replace the 715 Series and 455 Series. 2 car (KUHA 700 + KUMOHA 701) and 4 car (KUHA 700 + MOHA 701 + SAHA 700 + KUMOHA 701) formations exist. The 4-Car lacks a one-man driving setup and therefore has no door chime. This model is only used between Ichinoseki and Shiraishi.

contribution.name: 5000 Model(Tazawako Line)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train is used on the Tazawako Line, since the opening of the Akita Shinkansen. It operates only on the Tazawako Line. (Normally not stopping at Omagai, special trains are in operation for the Omagai Fireworks Festival.)

contribution.name: 5500 Model(Yamagata)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Built in 1993. Between the Ouu to Uetsu Mainline, this train was purposely selected for the passenger service. It was subsequently introduced all over the Tohoku region. The 5500 Model became a local service train after the completion of the Yamagata Shinkansen Shinjo Extension.

contribution.name: Third sector railroad
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Introduced as a result of the semi-privatization of the old JR main line, corresponding to today's Tohoku Shinkansen from Morioka to Hachinoe. The basic structure of the vehicle is the same as the JR701 Series except for the semi-cross seating arrangement. Shared with the Iwate Galaxy Railway Company.

contribution.name: Third sector railroad
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Introduced as a result of the semi-privatization of the old JR main line, corresponding to today's Tohoku Shinkansen from Morioka to Hachinoe. The basic structure of the vehicle is the same as the JR701 Series except for the semi-cross seating arrangement. Shared with the Aoimori Railway Company.

contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Manufactured as a replacement for the aging and inconvenient 165 Series used in the Niigata area as a local train. Operating direct current, the 701 Series was made of stainless steel, had long seats and VVVF Inverter in the driving trailer. Mainly used in the Niigata and Matsumoto areas.

contribution.name: Daiito Line Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Lightweight stainless steel is used inside the carriages and a VVVF Inverter is installed to allow enegry saving, reduced maintenance and better control. The body is a 3-Door type. One side of the interior has cabins, the other long seats. The 2-Car formation was introduced as the default in December, 1998.

contribution.name: Suburban
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train was introduced in March 2003 as a result of the electrification of JR West's Kohama Line (Higashi Maizuru - Tsuruga). There is only one type of KUMOHA125, but seperate and one-man driving is possible. It's top speed is 120km/h (Though on the Kohama Line, the top speed is 85km/h).

contribution.name: Moon Light Echigo Express
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The Kamimettari 165 Series Ｍ Formation operating as a night rapid train from Shinjuku to Niigata-Murakami-Sugano is known as the "Moon Light Echigo". Also, When not running as the Moon Light, it runs as the "Fairway (Shinjuku - Kuroiso)".

contribution.name: Rapid Sendai City Rabbit
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 455 Series used to be the express train known as "Matsushima" or "Zaou" but has now been refitted and used in suburban 3-Car formations. From 1988 to 1991, parts of the new carriages were reconstruced. This train is used on the Tohoku mainline from Kuroiso to Sendai to Rifu to Ichinoseki, the Tokiwa Line from Sendai to Mito and also on the West Banetsu Line. On the Tokiwa Line, the imposing 9-Car formations can be seen. The only rapid use for this train is the down-train (leaving Tokyo) "Sendai City Rabbit" that travels from Fukushima to Sendai.

contribution.name: SENZAN LINE 455
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train started driving on the Senzan Line from the 14th of October, 1997. The carriages were repainted in Blue and White to match the Mt. Zao winter landscape.

contribution.name: BANETSU LINE 455
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: From 1996, this repainted train was used to revigorate the West Banetsu Line. The 7-Car formation is used between Koriyama and Kitakata. The new color scheme has been applied to all cars. In December, 1999, it was superceeded and is now used very irregularly around Sendai.

contribution.name: INTER CITY TRAIN 169
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The E127 Series from Nagano was used to replace the 169 Series of Mitaka. This train was also put in use as Shinkansen Relay, Holiday Rapid, and Ogaki Relief Nozomi. The 9 car formation running on the Chuo Line is, althought the paint is very different, closely resembling the 169 Series of yesteryear.

contribution.name: Nagano Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This is the color schemed adopted in 1993 for the Nagano Winter Olympics (115, 165 and 169 Series.) Only the outside was painted.

contribution.name: Misuzu Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 4 Car formation consisted of a Saha 165 Series in the center of 169 Series 3 Car Formation. It is used in Nagano on the Shinetsu main line. The paint job is a green N-shaped stripe on the ivory body (called the N stripe). It uses the reclining seats of disused Shinkansen cars assuring an improvement of onboard service.

contribution.name: General Purpose Rail-Car
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This model was produced to replace the aging KIHA58 Series. It has an engine as powerful as the KIHA85 (350ps, 120km/h). Made of stainless steel, each car has 3 doors and cross-seats. They are used for rapid services on the Taketoyo line.

contribution.name: Suburban Rail-Car
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The design partly borrows from the TKJ Johoku Line model, this model is used as a short-range suburban service.

contribution.name: Limited Express Rail-Car
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: A new type of limited express diesel train, manufactured for rapid service on western Sanin Main Line. Scheduled for service in the Tottori area.

contribution.name: Suburban Rail-Car(YDC125)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The KIHA125 was created to run on low-traffic lines where the KIHA200 was too big. The body is a rail bus (NDC) built by Niigata Ironworks. The interior and exterior paint was designed by Mitooka Eiji of Down Design Laboratories.

contribution.name: Suburban Rail-Car
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The final model of the Japanese National Railways, with stainless steel body conversion and cross seat equipment. It is used on the Hohi, Kyudai, and Hisatsu lines.

contribution.name: Kansai Line Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The first light rail-car after the inauguration of JR West. This is the 0 Model where the engine is modified to 330 PS. It uses the "Long seat" formation.

contribution.name: New Limited Express
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: After the Shinkansen Ueno started operating, this model was considered for use on the local railroad limited express. The 185 Series 0 Model required snow- and cold-proofing and was remodelled in 1982 as 185 Series 200 Model. The 200 Model is being considered to be joined with the 165 Series as a measure for passing of the Usui Pass. Renewal construction was done, reclining seat conversion of the standard-sized car completed.

contribution.name: Izu Limited Express "Odoriko"
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 185 Series 0 Model was created in 1981 to run as the new limited express between Tokyo and Izu with a limited express. It runs the same routes as the 153 Series. The 185 Series also serves as New Rapid together with the 117 and 153 Series in the Kansai region.

contribution.name: Izu Limited Express "Odoriko"
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 185 Series 0 Model was created in 1981 to run as the new limited express between Tokyo and Izu with a limited express. It runs the same routes as the 153 Series. The 185 Series also serves as New Rapid together with the 117 and 153 Series in the Kansai region. It has recently been remodelled with new colors and reclining seats.

contribution.name: Izu Mixed Express
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train consists of a 185 Series and 153 Series train. It usually has 10 185 Series cars, with an additional 5 153 Series joined. This was used as the 'Izu' Express as well as a local train before the 'Odoriko' Limited Express was introduced.

contribution.name: Limited Express "Amagi" "Shirone"
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 157 Series was used as a Resort Express in the central capital region and was also in service on imperial routes to the Imperial Villas of Nasu and Izu. The DX local express model was equipped like the Limited Express, which gave it a unique position among JNR trains and was one of its appeals. In 1977 it was retired from service as Amagi Limited Express and the last remaining imperial formations were transferred to the 183 Series in 1983.

contribution.name: Hokuriku Express Train
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Based on the 471 Series, is was introduced on the 60 Hz Hokuriku Main Line and used in rough terrain. Formerly used as numerous bullet trains, is was gradually superseded by the limited express class of trains and is now serving as local trains.

contribution.name: Blue Liner
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: When the Shinkansen was extended to Okayama in 1972, the 153 Series were introduced intoducing facilities such as air-conditioning, speed up, air cushions, as well as networked scheduling and more frequent departures. However, due to fierce competition with the private railway corporations, it had to take the back seat to the 117 Series.

contribution.name: City Liner
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train was introduced in 1980 on the lines between Kyoto, Osaka, and Kobe to compete with the private railway corporations. It replaced the commodified 153 Series Blue Liners, had a unique style with a streamlined lead coach and was intended to serve as 'Special Rapid Service'. Two years later, it was also introduced in the Chukyo region as a 'Tokai Liner' in order to compete with Nagoya Railroad.

contribution.name: Tokai Liner
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train was introduced into the Kansai area and Nagoya area (Tokai liner) in 1982. It replaced the rapid 153 and 165 Series. From 1986, it was used on the West Chuo Line (6-Car and 4-Car). Later, it was also used in combination with the 211 Series, but as the new 311 Series was introduced in 1989, the train was taken out of service. From this time it was repainted in the corporate color of the company. The vehicle received a long seat conversion remodelling at 1992

contribution.name: 300 Model (Fukuchiyama Color)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This formation was remodelled for the Fukuchiyama line. It is painted in green on a white base and resembles the Tokai Coloring, but is not the same. In addition, the 300 Model has 2 seats more and this assures less congestion when getting on and off.

contribution.name: Sun Liner
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Adapted in March 1992 from the 115 Series 3500 Model as the intermediate car for the 117 Series. It then serviced Okayama where it was then used as the rapid "Sun Liner" between Fukuyama. It saw normal operation in the Okayama area and as a temporary rapid "Santo Liner" to Kyoto in 1994. After the "Santo Liner" service was discontinued, it operated as holiday rapid "Super Rabbit" between Fukuyama and Hiroshima (discontinued in 2002). Currently, it has been remodelled to one-man driving.

contribution.name: Ocean Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Made for the Wakayama area (Kinokuni Line, Wakayama Line), the 0-300 Models had been remodelled for one-man driving in 2001. Uses the same color scheme as the Nanki Limited Express "Ocean Arrow" (285 Series) that also operates in the area.

contribution.name: Rapid Mixed Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Introduced to compliment the Special Rapid 221 Series on mornings and evenings.
